Mikey Herman

San Francisco, CA · (925) 876-7496 · mherman315@gmail.com

I am a software developer with a strong command over languages such as JavaScript, Python, TypeScript, SQL, HTML, and CSS. I'm proficient in using a variety of tools and frameworks, including React, Flask, Django, Express, Node.js, and relational database managers like PostgreSQL and SQLite. I have hands-on experience contributing to large codebases and collaborating within Agile teams utilizing practices like daily stand-ups, sprints, and submitting PR requests. Prior to my tech career, I spent a decade at Trader Joe's in the Bay Area, honing my skills in team collaboration, problem-solving, and picking perfect watermelons. Beyond my professional life, I'm a food enthusiast with a boundless curiosity for learning, and I harbor a soft spot for 'terrible' TV. Looking ahead, I am committed to using my diverse skill set to tackle complex problems and make meaningful contributions to dynamic teams.

Experience

Software Engineer Intern

Rithm School

Rapidly acquired proficiency in Django within a three-day timeframe, quickly becoming a key contributor to the development and enhancement of a sophisticated 40K LOC learning management system

Adhered to and reinforced coding standards by utilizing pattern matching techniques, ensuring style consistency and maintainability throughout the codebase.

Migrated and modernized legacy code and designed SQL database models for course surveys to allow for an integrated user experience where users can create and complete surveys within the learning management system.

Designed and implemented a cohort page for users to toggle between cohorts they are enrolled in to improve user experience and allow for easier access to course material.

Implemented logic in templates, providing visibility to staff members regarding responsibility for posted events, enhancing accountability within the cohort.

Employed model factories with factory_boy, facilitating a comprehensive testing strategy and maintaining 98% test coverage.

Delivered code contributions through agile practices, engaging in 1 week sprints and daily stand-ups in a team of 10.

Authored detailed and comprehensive pull requests for ongoing tasks, effectively communicating progress and facilitating seamless hand-offs when necessary.

Interests

Beyond my web development pursuits, I have a keen interest in creating and repairing things. Recently, woodworking has captured my attention. Apart from this, I relish the challenge of building and fixing electronics. Not too long ago, I assembled a robot from a kit, powered by a Raspberry-Pi running Raspberry Pi OS - a project you can explore in the portfolio section.

In my first career, sailing the seven seas of culinary adventure at Trader Joe's, I developed some skill in the kitchen. I enjoy cooking for myself, my wife, and our friends - there's a unique joy that comes from feeding loved ones. When I'm not cooking, coding, or otherwise working on something, I will likely be found in Golden Gate Park or playing with our two cats, Brodie and Roscoe.
